channel.title: Keys not processed
channel.description: For some reason my bot doesn't input any normal key, however when I send \n it's reconiged. (Manually typing works to) I've injected the right value in the client. Also my mouse works completly. Anyone got an idea why?

item.title: Keys not processed
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

Fixed, It’s nessesary to send a KeyTyped event aswell, when sending normal characters

Read full topic

item.title: Keys not processed
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:5, topic:132097”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=183080.msg1665522#msg1665522 date=1186796132]
Look at the input package in cherokee, that is the correct way to send keys.

SourceForge

Cherokee

Download Cherokee for free. Cherokee is a fully extensible and scriptable automation engine for any and all java applets. To make it work for your favorite java applet the most you have to do is write is two classes.


[/quote]
Sorry

And it’s actually not the correct way, Runescape uses your virtual machine’s manufacturer to identify what key codes effect the game where, it’s best to mimic what the game assumes is the computer’s key/mouse input and not spoof generic events.[/quote]

Also included in cherokee is a test applet I wrote (and then yakman improved) that checks every aspect of an event and prints them to the command line, as well as visual confirmation drawn on screen. Sending real events with my mouse and keyboard produce identical results to sending events with the input classes, so how can it be detected since to the applet they are identical?

As to the filefilter, that is a good idea for identifying classes, but frank_ is correct in that I don’t want to load inner classes, just the classes that implement Script in this case.

Read full topic

item.title: Keys not processed
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:132097”]Look at the input package in cherokee, that is the correct way to send keys.

http://sourceforge.net/projects/cherokeeengine[/quote]
Sorry

And it’s actually not the correct way, Runescape uses your virtual machine’s manufacturer to identify what key codes effect the game where, it’s best to mimic what the game assumes is the computer’s key/mouse input and not spoof generic events.

By the way I took a peak at Cherokee…

[code]

class ClassFilter implements FileFilter {
public boolean accept(File f) {
String name = f.getName();
return f.isDirectory() || (name.endsWith(".class") && name.indexOf("$") == -1);
}
}[/code]

Should be replaced with something like…

class ClassFilter implements FileFilter {
    public boolean accept(File f) {
        RandomAccessFile raf = new RandomAccessFile(f, "r");
        int magic = raf.readInt();
        raf.close();
        return f.isDirectory() || magic == 0xCAFEBABE;
    }
}

As all classes must have the magic number CAFEBABE; whilst $ can be a part of a classes name.

Read full topic
